statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: Charleston Southern 94, North Greenville 65
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Jamarco Warren hit 5 3-pointers and scored 26 points to lead Charleston Southern to a 94-65 victory over North Greenville on Tuesday night. Jeremy Sexton added 18 points as the Buccaneers (12-14) shot 52.8 percent from the floor (35-for-66) and 40.7 percent from the 3-point line (11-for-27). Ten players scored as Charleston Southern snapped a three-game losing streak. Warren scored 20 first-half points to help the Buccaneers grab a 49-26 halftime lead. North Greenville (12-9) scored four of the first six points of the second half, but Charleston Southern responded with a 17-1 run for a 68-31 lead with 16:06 remaining in the game. Warren hit a 3-pointer for an 85-47 advantage with 10:07 to play. Kelvin Martin scored 14 and Kenny Mitchell added 13 points for Charleston Southern. Paul Harrison and Jimmy Ellis scored 11 points each to lead North Greenville.
